text: I was thinking of something similar to an iterator. Given a early stopping object `criterion` (which stores parameters but no state) there is a single function with two methods `update(criterion, loss) -> state`  to initiate with the first loss, and `update(criterion, loss, state) -> state`  to inject subsequent loss values. When the return value is `nothing` this indicates time to stop.  Would something like this work from your end?
